/*
OPENROWSET FUNCTION
###################

SOURCE: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/synapse-analytics/sql/develop-openrowset
*/

-- This is auto-generated code
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        -- uses the HTTP protocol
        BULK 'https://asacourseteststaccdl.dfs.core.windows.net/asa-course-test-adlfs-wsp-cnt/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'
    ) AS [result]


-- Changed to use the abfss protocol
-- HEADER_ROW set to TRUE, Row and Field terminators set
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        -- uses the ABFSS protocal
        BULK 'abfss://asa-course-test-adlfs-wsp-cnt@asacourseteststaccdl.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) AS [result]



/*
 DATA TYPES
 ==========
*/
-- Examine the data types for the columns
EXEC sp_describe_first_result_set N'SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK ''abfss://asa-course-test-adlfs-wsp-cnt@asacourseteststaccdl.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/taxi_zone.csv'',
        FORMAT = ''CSV'',
        PARSER_VERSION = ''2.0'',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    ) AS [result]'

/* Lets see the maximum length for each column
 Hence we can see that Synapse is actually using large number of lengths
 e.g., len_zone was assigned VARCHAR(8000) when it can actiually be  VARCHAR(50)
 -- this can minimize cost and performance for very large datasets
*/
SELECT
    MAX(LEN(LocationId)) AS len_LocationId,
    MAX(LEN(Borough)) AS len_Borough,
    MAX(LEN(Zone)) AS len_Zone,
    MAX(LEN(service_zone)) AS len_service_zone
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'abfss://asa-course-test-adlfs-wsp-cnt@asacourseteststaccdl.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) AS [result]

-- Use WITH clause to provide explicit data types
SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'abfss://asa-course-test-adlfs-wsp-cnt@asacourseteststaccdl.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) 
    WITH (
        LocationID SMALLINT,
        Borough VARCHAR(15),
        Zone VARCHAR(50),
        service_zone VARCHAR(15)
    )AS [result]


-- lets confirm the data types now
EXEC sp_describe_first_result_set N'SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK ''abfss://asa-course-test-adlfs-wsp-cnt@asacourseteststaccdl.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/taxi_zone.csv'',
        FORMAT = ''CSV'',
        PARSER_VERSION = ''2.0'',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FIELDTERMINATOR = '','',
        ROWTERMINATOR = ''\n''
    ) 
    WITH (
        LocationID SMALLINT,
        Borough VARCHAR(15),
        Zone VARCHAR(50),
        service_zone VARCHAR(15)
    )AS [result]'






/*
UTF-8 Collation
===============
- Go to the Messages to see if their is a UTF8 warning
*/

--Find out the default collation for our database
SELECT name, collation_name FROM sys.databases;


/*
1st mtd is to  specify UTF-8 Collation for VARCHAR columns
-- we now see that the UTF-8 error messages are now gone when we run the query
*/

SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'abfss://asa-course-test-adlfs-wsp-cnt@asacourseteststaccdl.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) 
    WITH (
        LocationID SMALLINT,
        Borough VARCHAR(15) COLLATE Latin1_General_100_CI_AI_SC_UTF8,
        Zone VARCHAR(50) COLLATE Latin1_General_100_CI_AI_SC_UTF8,
        service_zone VARCHAR(15) COLLATE Latin1_General_100_CI_AI_SC_UTF8
    )AS [result]

/*
2nd mtd is to apply the collation for the entire database rather than just columns
*/

-- 1.) create database
CREATE DATABASE nyc_taxi_discovery;

-- 2.) switch tyo the database
USE nyc_taxi_discovery;

-- 3.) alter the databace and change the collation to UTF-8
ALTER DATABASE nyc_taxi_discovery COLLATE Latin1_General_100_CI_AI_SC_UTF8;

-- 4.) we now see that the UTF-8 error messages are now gone when we run the query
SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'abfss://asa-course-test-adlfs-wsp-cnt@asacourseteststaccdl.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) 
    WITH (
        LocationID SMALLINT,
        Borough VARCHAR(15),
        Zone VARCHAR(50),
        service_zone VARCHAR(15)
    )AS [result]



/*
SELECTING A SUBSET OF COLUMNS USING THE "WITH" CLAUSE
=============================
*/
-- Select only subset of columns with headers 
SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'abfss://asa-course-test-adlfs-wsp-cnt@asacourseteststaccdl.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) 
    WITH (
        Borough VARCHAR(15),
        Zone VARCHAR(50)
    )AS [result]         


-- Read data from a file without header
--1.) lets see how it looks
SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'abfss://asa-course-test-adlfs-wsp-cnt@asacourseteststaccdl.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/taxi_zone_without_header.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) AS [result]     

--2.) lets use column position numbers (ordinal positions)
SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'abfss://asa-course-test-adlfs-wsp-cnt@asacourseteststaccdl.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/taxi_zone_without_header.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) 
    WITH (
        Zone VARCHAR(50) 3,
        Borough VARCHAR(15) 2
    )
AS [result]

--3.) Fix Column Names
SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'abfss://asa-course-test-adlfs-wsp-cnt@asacourseteststaccdl.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        FIRSTROW = 2,
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) 
    WITH (
        location_id SMALLINT 1,
        borough VARCHAR(15) 2,
        zone VARCHAR(50) 3,
        service_zone VARCHAR(15) 4
    )AS [result]

-- Create External Data Source
CREATE EXTERNAL DATA SOURCE nyc_taxi_data
WITH(
    LOCATION = 'abfss://asa-course-test-adlfs-wsp-cnt@asacourseteststaccdl.dfs.core.windows.net/'
)

CREATE EXTERNAL DATA SOURCE nyc_taxi_data_raw
WITH(
    LOCATION = 'abfss://asa-course-test-adlfs-wsp-cnt@asacourseteststaccdl.dfs.core.windows.net/raw'
)

SELECT
    *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'taxi_zone.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        FIRSTROW = 2,
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) 
    WITH (
        location_id SMALLINT 1,
        borough VARCHAR(15) 2,
        zone VARCHAR(50) 3,
        service_zone VARCHAR(15) 4
    )AS [result]


DROP EXTERNAL DATA SOURCE nyc_taxi_data;

SELECT name, location FROM sys.external_data_sources;
